intro: Acaena agrimonioides, commonly known as the New Zealand thistle, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its spiny, thistle-like appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by dark, woody fruits containing seeds. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. Acaena agrimonioides is often found in coastal and inland areas, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
